main_text:
If you close your eyes and visualize an apple, what you experience is
mental imagery – visual imagery. But mental imagery is far more
pervasive in our mental life than just visualizing. It happens in all
sense modalities and it plays a crucial role not just in perception,
but also in memory, emotions, language, desires and action-execution.
It even plays a substantial role in our engagement with artworks,
which makes it a key concept not only in philosophy of mind, but also
in aesthetics.
